column4: There's a major typo on http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/releasenotes/710tour, "If you are upgrading from Ubuntu 7.04, we have special easy to follow upgrade instructions."
read 'we have special, easy-to-follow upgrade instructions'
according to most style guides I know, the comma would be optional in this place.
I agree it's not beautiful English, but it's not a typo.
ThreeFingerPete: Adobe Flash plugin works fine on my 64bit machine
I'm a bit behind on the times, then
it's certainly not thanks to Adobe and their backwards support policy ;)
Still, I don't recommend the AMD64, because other apps don't work that I can't remember as I've never used AMD64 Ubuntu, just seen people complain here.
it used to be a real issue. With gutsy, it still takes a bit of trickery, but everything so far has worked for me, including googleearth and skype, all owing to the work of the good Medibuntu people
ah, I'm still using Dapper. I'm sorry
it's a hack, it is using two architectures. While I would recommend it, the Ubuntu team probably would not.
sorry, but it just struck me as an odd one. :|
I agree with you, and I didn't mean to criticize
